channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria to partially reopen pubs, restaurants as global COVID-19 cases top 4.5 million, Australian death toll stands at 98

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: The number of confirmed coronavirus cases worldwide has almost reached 4.7 million,
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: McDonald's shuts a dozen Victorian restaurants, cases worldwide reach almost 4.7 million

item.description: Emirates could cut 30 per cent of its jobs and speed up the retirement of its A380 fleet to cut costs amid the coronavirus outbreak, reports Bloomberg.
item.title: Emirates may cut 30,000 jobs, retire A380s sooner: report

item.description: The Fed chair says the speed of the US economy's recovery depends on finding a COVID-19 vaccine.
item.title: 'We really don't know': Fed chair warns US economic recovery could stretch through end of 2021, depends on vaccine

item.description: The annual meeting comes at a time when the WHO has attracted unprecedented global attention, and international scrutiny for its handling of the coronavirus.
item.title: WHO set to host assembly amid coronavirus controversy

item.description: Some of the online posts falsely claim that Ahmaud Arbery was carrying a hammer and wearing boots when he was killed, analysts said.
item.title: Far-right groups spread false claims about shooting victim Ahmaud Arbery: analysts

item.description: The ambassador was found in his bed in Herzliya by an embassy worker, officials said. Israeli police found no reason to suspect foul play his his death.
item.title: Chinese ambassador is found dead at home in Israel

item.description: Two major European leaders have told their citizens not to wait to be saved by a coronavirus vaccine.
item.title: Italy, UK send stark warnings: the world cannot wait for a vaccine

item.description: With borders closed, employers cannot rely on foreign labour to fill skills shortages, which means we need to develop the technological skills of our labour force during this crisis.
item.title: Coronavirus pandemic gives Australia a chance to fix our skills gaps in technology

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The state government was on Sunday frantically finalising its pandemic public transport plan as more Syneysiders return to work and students go back to school full-time.
item.title: Pop-up car parks planned as 'nervous' Premier fears public transport risk

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: NAB will temporarily hire more staff as it starts assessing the status of more than 80,000 mortgage holders who have put payments on hold due to COVID-19.Â
item.title: NAB to hire 400 staff to help assess COVID customer status

item.description: As China huffs and puffs about trade, Australia must either hold the line on its calls for a pandemic inquiry or risk its international credibility.
item.title: Australia must calmly hold its ground with China

item.description: For those of us lucky enough to still be in work, the biggest shift has been from office block to kitchen table.
item.title: So, what does the new 'normal' look like for women?

item.description: Before hospital admission,Gabriela Domicelj was waking in the night every hour, catapulted into consciousness by her lungs gasping for air.
item.title: It took me 50 days and three hospital stays to recover from COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Consumers receiving the coronavirus supplement and stimulus payments are shopping much more than normal.
item.title: Spending would collapse without crisis payments to households

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Country towns along the corridor would benefit from job opportunities and economic growth.
item.title: East coast mega-region would boost national growth: report

item.description: I remember tears welling in my 12-year-old eyes when it looked like E.T. was going to die and later, my mother gently falling asleep as a chum and I watched Tron, feeling like weâd just seen the future.
item.title: George Street cinemas captured movie of our lives

item.dc:creator: Andrew Charlton
item.description: Infection rates are down and spending is up. Time to wind back the generous government support programs, right? Wrong.
item.title: Fragile economy cannot cope with early end to government support

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: James Roberts' partner has opened up on the events that led to the South Sydney centre checking himself into rehab.
item.title: Roberts eyes Roosters showdown just seven days after checking out of rehab

item.description: On January 24 and February 13, 2020, the Herald published articles suggesting Louise Clegg intended to run as a candidate in upcoming Lord Mayoral elections. The articles may have suggested Ms Cleggâs candidature was in the mind of her husband, energy minister Angus Taylor, when he wrote a letter to Sydney Lord Mayor Clover Moore relying on erroneous figures concerning travel expenses that were contained in a document. The Herald acknowledges it had no information to suggest that any document was forged by Minister Taylor or Ms Clegg. The Herald also acknowledges Ms Clegg has never intended to seek office for Lord Mayor of Sydney. The Herald apologises for any harm to Ms Cleggâs personal and professional reputation.
item.title: Apology

item.dc:creator: Stephen Brook
item.description: The coronavirus outbreak has put intense strain on the media industry in ways that are now starting to surface in curious ways.
item.title: Pandemic pressure puts Nine boss in spotlight

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The Australian share market is expected to start the week in positive territory but coronavirus-sparked volatility is likely to reign supreme as the week progresses.
item.title: ASX tipped to climb as investors eye fresh set of economic data

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Canadian asset manager BrookfieldÂ has threatened to walk away from the Virgin Australia sale process in frustration with how Deloitte is managing the process.
item.title: BrookfieldÂ threatens to walk away from Virgin Australia in frustration

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: New Rugby Australia chairman Hamish McLennan says the negotiating table for the broadcasting rights is open to all interested parties.
item.title: New Rugby Australia chairman confident the code will get screen time

item.dc:creator: Royce Millar
item.description: Storm surges since Easter have left coastal communities concerned for beaches and homes
item.title: Erosion from surging seas threaten roads, homes and beaches

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: With the lockdown slowly being unlocked a return to the 'lifter vs leaners' approach to politics could be fatal for the Morrison government.
item.title: Obsession with jobless offers Morrison's best chance of survival

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Overhauling the childcare sector to reduce the cost burden on families could help bring more women into the workplace and improve productivity, with leading economists encouraging the government to undertake a wide-ranging review to help boost the post-coronavirus recovery.
item.title: Childcare cost overhaul would be 'kicker' for post-coronavirus recovery

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Australia Community Media's Antony Catalano is in discussions with Nine Entertainment Co about extending a large printing deal.
item.title: Nine in discussions with Catalano over print deal

item.dc:creator: Genevieve Rota
item.description: Now is the perfect time to catch up on the best books, films, television shows, music and podcasts you might have missed.
item.title: Soundtracks that nearly outshone the films they were made for

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Monday, May 18

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: Captain Cookâs diary, the log book of the Endeavour and other historical papers, have reached Australia.
item.title: In the Herald: May 18, 1923

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Business groups and economists have attacked unions seeking a higher minimum wage during the pandemic as tensions rise over the best way to help workers and revive the economy.
item.title: 'Look the word crisis up in a dictionary': Businesses attack union minimum wage rise calls

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: The business of one of AMP's star financial advisers appeared to have cut and pasted signatures on to loan contracts, including one for a $600,000 loan to a woman.
item.title: Signature scandal puts more pressure on AMP's battle-weary management

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Families that have taken elderly relatives out of aged care during COVID-19 will no longer face penalties to hold their spot.
item.title: Reprieve for hundreds of families keeping elderly relatives out of aged care during pandemic

item.description: As COVID-19 continues to spread illness and destruction across the globe, the health of Jason Sellynâs friendships has only gone one way: up.
item.title: Has the pandemic given new meaning to your friendships?

item.dc:creator: Michael Lallo
item.description: The pleasures and pitfalls of remote collaboration.
item.title: Nude partners, noisy kids all part of virtual TV writers' rooms

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Venture capitalist Rick Baker is confident the pandemic will provide fresh impetus to entrepreneurs willing to think outside the box and build new businesses.
item.title: Blackbird's Rick Baker tips coronavirus innovation boom

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Dig Howitt is urging policymakers to use the coronavirus-induced economic shock to revisit ideas that encourage Australian companies to invest in homegrown ideas.
item.title: Cochlear boss says an innovation reset will be key to economic recovery

item.description: 40 years ago, north-west USA's Mount St Helens erupted, generating a volcanic blast that devastated 500 square kilometres and killed approximately 57 people.
item.title: From the Archives, 1980: The Mount St. Helens eruption

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: The pandemic has proven, loud and clear, that gaming is certainly not a ânicheâ activity belonging to teenage boys.
item.title: Forget what you think you know about video games

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: Patients are sounding the alarm over a string of troubling incidents at two country NSW hospitals.
item.title: From a walk at Manly to amputation: hospitals putting 'lives at risk'

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: A not-for-profit organisation is one of the final parties interested in acquiring parts of Australia's national news agency Australian Associated Press.
item.title: Social Ventures Australia emerges as potential white knight for AAP

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Coronavirus treatment trials are filling up fast as thousands of Australian healthcare workers put their hands up to get them going as quickly as possible.
item.title: Australian applicants flock to COVID-19 clinical trials

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: The Andrews government will announce a $500 million package to build 168 new units and upgrade 23,000 more to help bolsterÂ the Victorian economy ravaged by coronavirus.Â
item.title: Victorian government undertakes biggest social housing spend since GFC

item.dc:creator: Nicole Precel
item.description: Workers from the affected restaurants have been told to stay home for two weeks and are being advised to be tested for COVID-19.
item.title: McDonald's closes 12 restaurants after a delivery driver tests positive to COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: A majority of Sydney Road users support the removal of on-street parking to make way for a protected cycling lane as part of a long-awaited overhaul, a survey has found.
item.title: Sydney Rd users support removal of car parks for cycling lane: survey
